page.title: 05MASTIN MOOR AND LOWGATES
page.content: Mastin Moor is a small village at the side of the A619 in North East Derbyshire. It consists on a large council estate about forty years old.The dwellings are mostly semi-detached houses although there are some old people's bungalows.Eighty-eight of the houses are being modernized.Most of the houses do not have garages next to them but there are groups of garages round the edge of the estate.The houses in the village are well spaced with many grassy areas. The village is surrounded by rough grazing.The amenities consist of a chip shop,a general store and an offlicence a community centre, Miners Welfare and two pubs,to the South of Mastin Moor is a cricket pitch which connects it to Lowgates,part of the edge of Staveley.This area is a
